page.title: 01INTRO.BURGHILL/CREDENHILL
page.content: Our "D block" is a largely rural and agricultural area to the North West of Hereford. The principal settlements are Credenhill,Burghill, Tillington and Brinsop. Credenhill the largest settlement its population increased by the presence of a large R.A.F. camp situated close to the village. The highest point is Credenhill Park Wood which is 219m. above sea level and surmounted by a large Iron Age Camp.Other antiquities of interest in the area include the Roman road which crosses the block diagonally from South West to North East and the three parish churches of Credenhill,Brinsop and Burghill. Each contains items of noteworthy historic interest. Perhaps the most important domestic building is Brinsop Court a timbered and moated manor house with strong Wordsworth associations.
